intro: Colea pinnatifolia, commonly known as the featherleaf colea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Colea pinnatifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
